attributes.action: Government to recognise bravery of Ryan Lock who died fighting ISIS.
attributes.additional_details: Government to consider awarding the George Cross.
attributes.background: Ryan Lock was a 20 year old chef from Chichester in the UK who travelled to Syria to fight ISIS, an organisation the British government are also fighting. Ryan fought and died. It is believed he took his own life to avoid capture. Ryan should be recognised by the UK government for his sacrifice.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
